localizedDescriptions.en: Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).
A group of observations that are recorded at the same time and record the blood pressure, pulse, temperature and other readings.
The observed characteristics of spontaneous breathing as would commonly be recorded as part of a 'vital signs' examination.
Rate of respiration.
The amount of oxygen being delivered, or to be delivered, to the patient.
Percentage of inspired oxygen.
The patient is receiving air, equivalent to 21% O2, 0.21 FiO2 and an oxygen flow rate  of 0.

annotations.comment: Where 'On air' is set to true, Oxygen flow rate, FiO2 and Percent O2 should not be recorded. Conversely 'On air'should omitted if Oxygen flow rate, FiO2 or Percent O2 are recorded.

localizedDescriptions.en: Record details about the rate and associated attributes for a pulse or heart beat.
The rate, measured in beats per minute.

annotations.comment: Run-time name constraints have been specified, in order to simplify the renaming of this data element to Pulse Rate or Heart Rate, as required.

localizedDescriptions.en: More specific pattern of an irregular pulse or heart beat.
The pattern is irregular in a regular pattern,. For example, a dropped beat once every 'n' beats.
The pattern is irregular in a chaotic and unpredictable manner. For example, atrial fibrillation.

annotations.comment: Selection of a value from this value set is only valid if 'Irregular' is selected from the 'Regularity' data element.

localizedDescriptions.en: Additional narrative about the pulse or heart beat findings not captured in other fields.
A measurement of the body temperature, which is a surrogate for the whole body temperature of the person.
The measured body temperature (as a surrogate for the whole body).
Simple scale used as part of an assessment to measure and record a patient's responsiveness, indicating their level of consciousness. AVPU is an acronym for 'Alert', 'Voice', 'Pain', 'Unresponsive'.
The observation of the patient's responsiveness.
The patient is fully awake and alert.
The patient responds in any way to a voice stimulus.
The patient responds in any way to a pain stimulus.
The patient does not respond in any way to voice or pain stimuli.

The local measurement of arterial blood pressure which is a surrogate for arterial pressure in the systemic circulation.  Most commonly, use of the term 'blood pressure' refers to measurement of brachial artery pressure in the upper arm.
Peak systemic arterial blood pressure  - measured in systolic or contraction phase of the heart cycle.
Minimum systemic arterial blood pressure - measured in the diastolic or relaxation phase of the heart cycle.
Method of monitoring blood gas measurements such as Spo2 and pTCO2 by indirect, currently non-invasive, means.
Measured via pulse oximetry, the saturation of oxygen in the peripheral blood.

annotations.comment: spO2 is defined as the ratio of oxyhaemoglobin (HbO2) to the total concentration of haemoglobin (HbO2 + deoxyhaemoglobin).

localizedDescriptions.en: NEWS (National Early Warning Score) is a simple score used to provide an objective indication of a patient's degree of clinical deterioration. This version follows guidance issued by the UK Royal College of Physicians.
The total sum of all the NEWS parameter ordinals.

annotations.comment: Total score may be generated at run-time.

localizedDescriptions.en: Description of any incidental factors that may have contributed to the score.

annotations.comment: For example: If the patient has COPD.

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative summary or overview about a patient, specifically from the perspective of a healthcare provider, and with or without associated interpretations.
The summary, assessment, conclusions or evaluation of the clinical findings.
